content.description: Fun, easy offwidth. Try out some tricks! There's a double fistjam if you want it. Dirty at the moment.
content.location: The obvious offwidth to the right of Backslash. Visible in the picture of Backslash.

content.description: Start low and climb the face using the crack and whatever else is in reach. Could maybe be done with just the crack. The landing's not great.
content.protection: Pad, maybe a spotter. More awkward than dangerous I think.
content.location: At Backslash, go around to the downstream side of the ridge and climb the crease up towards the egg shaped boulder resting on top of other rock. Slashback is on the face pointed downstream.

content.description: Start with the distinctive slanted crimp for a right hand and low feet. Move up along the arete, transition out left at a featured seam. May get easier with more traffic as hold clean up/become available. Be warned, the top is pretty covered with lichen, etc. and the landing isn't great.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter for the unsure.
content.location: Look for the tall, slightly off-vertical face that's directed towards you as you come down the trail. Find the crimp rail in the center.

content.description: Sit start. Move up and right on big, friendly flat holds. Fun moves.
content.location: The uphill side of the Backslash boulders. Look for the step-like holds.

content.description: An outcropping of boulders on the downstream side of the second clearing in River Right. Hosts a number of tallish lines. More to be added.
